task.summary:
Fix Indentation and Platform-Specific Signal Handling
Corrected indentation in the platform check block to prevent IndentationError and updated signal handling to conditionally register SIGTSTP based on the operating system, ensuring compatibility across Windows and Unix-like systems. Improved code clarity and reliability for cross-platform use.

Refactor tool startup logic to prompt for terms acceptance before proceeding
Moved the terms acceptance prompt to the start of the program's execution. Ensured that users must accept the terms before providing an input file or URL. Updated the logic to handle invalid inputs gracefully, prompting users appropriately. Improved user experience by displaying a clear warning message with terms and conditions before proceeding with the main functionality of the scanner.cross-platform use.

chore: restore to backup version, reverting recent changes
This commit reverts the codebase to the last known stable backup version. All recent changes made after the backup have been discarded. The decision to revert was made due to the introduction of issues related to repeated prompts for accepting terms in the tool's execution.
The tool will now correctly prompt for terms only once upon startup, ensuring a smoother user experience moving forward. All previous modifications have been removed, and the codebase is restored to its previous state.

New:ðŸ”¨Document the process for creating the executable
This commit documents the complete procedure for creating a standalone executable (.exe) from the Python script using PyInstaller. It includes the installation of PyInstaller, the command used for compilation with a custom icon, and troubleshooting steps for ensuring proper execution without dependencies. Additionally, the commit highlights how to handle issues with icon display in Windows Explorer, ensuring users have a smooth experience when running the application.

Fix Indentation and Platform-Specific Signal Handling
Corrected indentation in the platform check block to prevent IndentationError and updated signal handling to conditionally register SIGTSTP based on the operating system, ensuring compatibility across Windows and Unix-like systems. Improved code clarity and reliability for cross-platform use.

Refactor tool startup logic to prompt for terms acceptance before proceeding
Moved the terms acceptance prompt to the start of the program's execution. Ensured that users must accept the terms before providing an input file or URL. Updated the logic to handle invalid inputs gracefully, prompting users appropriately. Improved user experience by displaying a clear warning message with terms and conditions before proceeding with the main functionality of the scanner.cross-platform use.

chore: restore to backup version, reverting recent changes
This commit reverts the codebase to the last known stable backup version. All recent changes made after the backup have been discarded. The decision to revert was made due to the introduction of issues related to repeated prompts for accepting terms in the tool's execution.
The tool will now correctly prompt for terms only once upon startup, ensuring a smoother user experience moving forward. All previous modifications have been removed, and the codebase is restored to its previous state.

New:Document the process for creating the executable
This commit documents the complete procedure for creating a standalone executable (.exe) from the Python script using PyInstaller. It includes the installation of PyInstaller, the command used for compilation with a custom icon, and troubleshooting steps for ensuring proper execution without dependencies. Additionally, the commit highlights how to handle issues with icon display in Windows Explorer, ensuring users have a smooth experience when running the application.
